I've been playing CSGO for probably 4-5 years. Was a hardcore COD player on console. The transition from console to PC was hard, and the transition to a game like CSGO was harder. The learning curve for this game is insane, and the skill ceiling is incredibly high. It's very hard to be a new player, but it's probably the best FPS out there, so it's worth it.

I didn't enjoy it.

It isn't just because I suck at it. The controls itself are quite good.

What ruined it was that every time I played Russian guy was yelling in the mic.
If it wasn't a Russian guy screaming your ears of, people were constantly talking shit to each other.

My experience with the game was bad. I really didn't like the community. It's toxic, hateful and as result really unappealing to me.
